forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 49. Northwest wind around 3 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. Northwest wind around 6 mph.

weather_report:
As the early hours stretch into a new day, Downtown San Francisco awakens to a night steeped in clarity, kissed with cool breezes brushing through at just three miles per hour. The moon quietly presides over the cityscape, casting its gentle glow on the treasured hills and valleys, a precursor to the promise of a mostly sunny Saturday. As dawn breaks, the air will warm, nudging highs close to a modest sixty-one degrees, but come afternoon, you might feel the chill linger as temperatures ease to the mid-fifties. 

The skies appear mostly clear now, with whispers of fog lingering at the fringes where the bay meets the ocean. The marine layer is content to stay at bay, offering vistas of the iconic Golden Gate, an invitation to embrace the beauty of the day ahead. For those considering how to dress, a light jacket or sweater would serve well, perfect for the cool temperatures that accompany the morning air. Perhaps indulge in a stroll through one of the city’s vibrant neighborhoods, or take a moment to savor a warm beverage at a local café while basking in the tranquil ambiance of a day that promises comfort and splendid views, far from the tumult of life.
